video.title: Create An Elementor WordPress Website – Elementor Tutorial For Beginners 2022
video.description:
In this full Elementor WordPress course for beginners, you will learn how to to create beautiful, responsive webpages using a drag and drop interface.

Get a domain and hosting here: https://www.hostinger.com/start

✏️ Beau Carnes created this course. 

⭐️ Course Contents ⭐️
⌨️ (0:00:00) Introduction
⌨️ (0:00:41) Hosting and domain name
⌨️ (0:04:18) Setup custom email and SSH
⌨️ (0:06:34) Install WorPpress
⌨️ (0:10:02) Install Elementor and templates
⌨️ (0:14:52) Editing with Elementor overview
⌨️ (0:19:19) Updating homepage with Elementor
⌨️ (0:23:34) Adding custom images
⌨️ (0:27:47) Customizing text and other features
⌨️ (0:38:04) Adding widgets with Elementor
⌨️ (0:44:39) Adding video to website
⌨️ (0:46:49) Customizing backgrounds
⌨️ (0:53:10) Making website look good on mobile
⌨️ (0:55:52) Updating about page
⌨️ (1:02:39) Updating contact page
⌨️ (1:05:42) Setting up contact form
⌨️ (1:08:13) Update page header
⌨️ (1:13:05) Update page footer
⌨️ (1:15:11) How to add and remove pages
⌨️ (1:19:54) Updating final settings
⌨️ (1:21:20) Conclusion

🏗 Hostinger provided a grant that made this course possible. 

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://freecodecamp.org/news

I was following along one of the youtube wp tutorial. I bought domain name and host and published a random website. 

Now how can I delete that elementor theme and template and start all over again? In appearance themes I deleted the kits but it didn't work.
Please help.🙏

topLevelComment.author: angyeet
topLevelComment.text: Why does everyone want to give up learning after watching this video? if you want to become a web dev then learn the skills. No one is going to hire someone who only knows how to drag and drop. There is a limit as to how many things you can do with drag and drop

replies.author: Muhammad Rivandra
replies.text:
Making website using wordpress is really fast, but, i think if we want to make full blown system, Coding is the best choice. 

I learn both

replies.author: Nick Paz
replies.text: Haha how can anyone give up learning to code after watching an elementor video. Elementor is a nice tool but you can only build a pretty basic website with it

replies.author: Eric Catlin
replies.text: A web developer built that drag and drop interface

replies.author: Fred BluntStoned
replies.text:
Right tool for right job. Depends on job. This is just another tool.
Majority of people don't want to invest time/money into coding. Good. I don't want absolutely everyone coding. I like to be special in my field and to leave other tasks to other people's skill sets.

replies.author: Vs Sm
replies.text: Actually this 'drag and drop' skill is required for positions like Content Manager in any big company with large public and internal web sites, especially multilingual ones. Most of the modern and expensive web systems have this feature to provide more control over the content without paying a high price for development. However, these complex systems still require a lot of back- and frontend development.

topLevelComment.author: Hamzaye HDTV
topLevelComment.text: So should i not waste my time learning to code? I just mastered html and css and i was about to start learning Js should stop it? Is coding a website no longer needed?

replies.author: K Francisco
replies.text:
CMS sites are only for simple solutions specifically for small businesses with super tight budgets. You CANNOT create advanced complex webpages with it .

Also web development is extremely vast field encompassing more than just making simple webpages.

replies.author: Simon RV
replies.text: don't stop learning to code, it is going to be needed for a very lonnnnnngg termn, this tools can make it easier to build a website but can't teach people how to build a proper one, and with all necessary technicals things, this is good for small businesses but whenever you need to do something else and more complicated you need to code, you will need a dev

replies.author: B_Shadoink
replies.text: i used to think like that so here are my thought, you need those languages you learn to make more advanced editing and extending functionality of wordpress sites and also some types of websites you really cant make them with wordpress or it just not a good idea so learning to code will never be a bad idea.

replies.author: Vs Sm
replies.text: You should learn how to code these fancy features. 😂

replies.author: NN Web
replies.text: No, stoping is not an option. 😄 You can extend WordPress with those skills, just add a little of PHP. However with HTML and CSS you can build a better front-end part of contact form, or to customize Elementor widgets. I like to do both of that very often on my projects.
